alert.note: Alert for Kenedy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued December 23 at 6:01AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 expected. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Kenedy Island County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until noon CST today. For the Wind Advisory, until 9 AM CST this morning. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
